*div1 type="summary"* *p*Depredation of Wacoes.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-17-1826">January 17th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir I wish to inform you that in my absence the *person_mentioned*Waco Indians*/person_mentioned* Came to my *location_mentioned*House */location_mentioned*and plundered and Carried off the following articals two sheets two Quilts and Wagon Cover and nearly all our wearing Clothing and Table Furniture, it appears from the Conduct of those *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned* that we Cannot Settle the *location_mentioned*frontiers of this Colony*/location_mentioned* unless we Can have an understanding with them, for if they are allowed to Rob and plunder it will be impossible to *location_mentioned*settle the frontiers of this Country*/location_mentioned* for I am determined to kill the first one that undertakes to Rob me again, which will Commence a war. I have always wished peace if we Could have it on honourable terms. I do think peace Can be made with those *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned*, but it is not my place to dictate for you—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John Castleman*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo. Stephen F- Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
